Topic.Title: My Basis Disclosure and Estimate

Message.Msg: poke, The only thing the general public has to go on are the "rumors" reported by the media. None of the parties have commented. The use of the overseas cash in the deal, in my opinion has been under-reported and appears to me to be a low probability. I was just using what's been mostly reported. Keep in mind that the price of the deal and the financing are two distinct things. Just because the buyers can find more cash, such as the overseas asset, doesn't mean they want to pay a higher price.

Message.Title: Do not forget the $10bn of cash on the balance sheet...
Message.Msg: Dell has roughly $10bn in non operating cash on the balance sheet which has to be added to the company's valuation. The $23bn value of the deal excludes this non operating cash. Otherwise SL could just put up $10bn to buy the company (the remaining $10bn coming from the company's balance sheet and $3bn being Michael's holdings). DELL valuation is roughly as follows: put a 8x PE on earnings of $2.5bn and add $10bn of the non operating cash = a total value of $30bn, i.e. $17 per share. Add-in a takeover premium to give an incentive for shareholders to sell and DELL's takeover price could be in the $18 to $20 area. All those people thinking $14 is the LBO price are implicitly valuing DELL at a PE of 5x.... Even HPQ trades with a higher multiple.

Message.Title: A bid at $13 or $14 does not make sense
Message.Msg: Dell has cash of $6.49 per share. Back that out of a $13.00 offer and one is left with $6.51.Apply the analysts concencous estimate of $1.71 gives a 3.8 mutiple.Assume a $14 bid you get a 4.4 multiple of 4.4.In my opinion a bid in the $16-18 range would seem to make more logical sense. Time will tell.

Topic.Title: Every talk is cheap... 10 $ or 20 $ ? Only God knows. When the announcement ?

Message.Msg: This is whole story has been manipulated. Other options could be considered, including a reverse stock split or share buyback. Take a look at BBY as an example of how leaks and PR were used to run-up the price over the past several months. The point is, essentially, Michael Dell wants to get the highest price possible. If nothing is announced in the near-term -- including Monday -- I wouldn't be surprised. Leaks, repeat leaks, are being used to maniupulate the press into getting the price to rise. This could all backfire. Again, look at how BBY price collaspsed after initial reports broke. Now, the stock is running up because a March deadline was set for the former founder to cough up a "fair price." I'd be careful in investing in Dell right now. You don't know how this thing my swing. These LBO talks aren't not meant to put money into the pockets of small retai investors. It's all about putting money into the pockets of big investors. This isn't socialism, folks.
